alert.note: Alert for Bay; Genesee; Lenawee; Livingston; Macomb; Midland; Monroe; Oakland; Saginaw; Shiawassee; St. Clair; Tuscola; Washtenaw; Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued March 09 at 1:46PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...2023 SPRING FLOOD AND WATER RESOURCES OUTLOOK NUMBER 3... Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service probabilistic outlook for the major rivers in the Saginaw River basin and the Clinton ...Rouge...Huron and Raisin River basins... The Detroit/Pontiac office of the National Weather Service has implemented Advance Hydrologic Prediction Service (AHPS) for all the model locations in the above mentioned basins. AHPS enables the National Weather Service to provide long range probabilistic river outlooks. This service is also available on the internet at WWW.CRH.NOAA.GOV/DTX. In the table below...the current (CS) and historical (HS) or normal probabilities of exceeding minor...moderate...and major flood stages are listed for the valid time period. CS values indicate the probability of reaching a flood category based on current conditions. HS values indicate the probability of reaching a flood category based on historical or normal conditions. When the value of CS is more then HS...the probability of exceeding that level is higher then normal. When the value of CS is less then HS...the probability of exceeding that level is lower than normal. :...TABLE 1--PROBABILITIES FOR MINOR...MODERATE AND MAJOR FLOODING... VALID PERIOD: 03/13/2023 - 06/11/2023 : CURRENT AND HISTORICAL CHANCES : OF EXCEEDING FLOOD CATEGORIES : AS A PERCENTAGE(%) CATEGORICAL : FLOOD STAGES (FT) : MINOR MODERATE MAJOR LOCATION MINOR MOD MAJOR : CS HS CS HS CS HS -------- ----- ----- ----- : ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- Pine River Midland 12.0 14.0 16.0 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 Tittabawassee River Midland 24.0 25.0 28.0 9 20 7 18 <5 7 Shiawassee River Owosso 7.0 9.0 10.0 19 21 <5 <5 <5 <5 Kearsley Creek Davison 10.0 11.0 12.0 16 27 <5 <5 <5 <5 Flint River Flint 13.0 15.0 17.0 <5 6 <5 <5 <5 <5 Cass River Cass City 14.0 18.0 20.0 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 Vassar 14.0 15.0 18.0 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 Frankenmuth 17.0 20.0 25.0 15 28 <5 7 <5 <5 Saginaw River Saginaw 17.0 19.0 24.0 17 24 <5 13 <5 <5 LEGEND CS = CONDITIONAL SIMULATION (CURRENT OUTLOOK) HS = HISTORICAL SIMULATION FT = FEET :...TABLE 1--PROBABILITIES FOR MINOR...MODERATE AND MAJOR FLOODING... VALID PERIOD: 03/13/2023 - 06/11/2023 : CURRENT AND HISTORICAL CHANCES : OF EXCEEDING FLOOD CATEGORIES : AS A PERCENTAGE(%) CATEGORICAL : FLOOD STAGES (FT) : MINOR MODERATE MAJOR LOCATION MINOR MOD MAJOR : CS HS CS HS CS HS -------- ----- ----- ----- : ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- Clinton River Clinton Twp 16.0 17.0 19.0 12 13 <5 6 <5 <5 Mt Clemens 16.0 17.0 18.0 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 North Branch Clinton River Mt Clemens 15.0 16.0 18.0 <5 5 <5 <5 <5 <5 River Rouge Detroit 15.0 18.0 20.0 27 30 <5 5 <5 <5 Middle River Rouge Dearborn Hts 10.0 11.0 12.0 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 Lower Rouge River Dearborn 11.0 12.0 13.0 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 Mill Creek Dexter 12.0 13.0 14.0 <5 9 <5 7 <5 <5 Huron River Hamburg 7.0 7.5 8.0 19 30 <5 14 <5 10 Ann Arbor 16.0 17.0 18.0 <5 10 <5 <5 <5 <5 River Raisin Tecumseh 13.0 14.0 15.0 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 Adrian 18.0 19.0 20.0 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 <5 Blissfield 683.0 685.0 687.0 10 14 <5 6 <5 <5 Dundee 650.0 652.0 653.0 9 12 <5 7 <5 5 Monroe 9.0 10.0 11.0 12 14 <5 <5 <5 <5 LEGEND CS = CONDITIONAL SIMULATION (CURRENT OUTLOOK) HS = HISTORICAL SIMULATION FT = FEET ...PAST PRECIPITATION...Precip for the last month has helped bring southeast lower Michigan out of severe drought but still remain in abnormally dry to moderate drought. ...RIVER CONDITIONS... Most rivers are flowing around normal except for the River Raisin basin which is flowing slightly above normal. Any river ice is thin and limited to the shoreline. There is no ice jam threat. ...SOIL CONDITIONS AND FROST DEPTH... Upper zone soil conditions have moisten up with the past precipitation but still remain drier then normal. Frost depth ranges from zero in most locations to maybe an inch or two in isolated areas. Well below average for this time of year. ...SNOW COVER AND LIQUID WATER CONTENT... Snow pack across the area ranges from zero to a couple of inches with about 2 to 6 more likely to fall March 10 before the outlook goes into effect. Water content in any snow pack will remain below an inch. ...WEATHER OUTLOOK... The outlook for the next 8-14 days calls for below average temperatures and near normal precipitation. The outlook for the rest of Spring is for near to above normal temperatures and above normal precipitation. ...FLOOD SUMMARY OUTLOOK... Even with above normal precipitation in the past few weeks, the risk for moderate to severe flooding for area rivers the rest of the Spring is below average and will be driven mainly by excessive rainfall. This is the last Spring Flood Potential Outlook for 2023. Additional supportive data and explanations are available on the internet at WWW.CRH.NOAA.GOV/DTX
